metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Google Maps Overlays
Google Maps - Overlays
Overlays are objects on the map that are bound to latitude/longitude coordinates.
content.html: Overlays are objects on the map that are bound to latitude/longitude coordinates.

content.text: Google Maps has several types of overlays:
content.html: Google Maps has several types of overlays:

content.text: Google Maps - Add a Marker
The Marker constructor creates a marker. Note that the position property must be set for the marker to display.
content.html: The Marker constructor creates a marker. Note that the position property must be set for the marker to display.

content.text: Add the marker to the map by using the setMap() method:
content.html: Add the marker to the map by using the setMap() method:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
var marker = new google.maps.Marker({position: myCenter});

marker.setMap(map);

content.code:
var marker = new google.maps.Marker({position: myCenter});

marker.setMap(map);

syntax_highlighting.text:
var marker = new google.maps.Marker({position: myCenter});

marker.setMap(map);

content.code_html:
var marker = new google.maps.Marker({position: myCenter});

marker.setMap(map);

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
var marker = new google.maps.Marker({position: myCenter});

marker.setMap(map);

content.text: Google Maps - Animate the Marker
The example below shows how to animate the marker with the animation property:
content.html: The example below shows how to animate the marker with the animation property:

content.code_html:
var marker = new google.maps.Marker({
  position:myCenter,
  animation:google.maps.Animation.BOUNCE
});

marker.setMap(map);

content.text: Google Maps - Icon Instead of Marker
The example below specifies an image (icon) to use instead of the default marker:
content.html: The example below specifies an image (icon) to use instead of the default marker:

content.code_html:
var marker = new google.maps.Marker({
  position:myCenter,
  icon:'pinkball.png'
});

marker.setMap(map);

content.text: Google Maps - Polyline
A Polyline is a line that is drawn through a series of coordinates in an ordered sequence.
content.html: A Polyline is a line that is drawn through a series of coordinates in an ordered sequence.

content.text: A polyline supports the following properties:

content.code_html:
var myTrip = [stavanger,amsterdam,london];
var flightPath = new google.maps.Polyline({
  path:myTrip,
  strokeColor:"#0000FF",
  strokeOpacity:0.8,
  strokeWeight:2
});

content.text: Google Maps - Polygon
A Polygon is similar to a Polyline in that it consists of a series of coordinates in an ordered sequence. However, polygons are designed to define regions within a closed loop.
content.html: A Polygon is similar to a Polyline in that it consists of a series of coordinates in an ordered sequence. However, polygons are designed to define regions within a closed loop.

content.text: Polygons are made of straight lines, and the shape is "closed" (all the lines connect up).
content.html: Polygons are made of straight lines, and the shape is "closed" (all the lines connect up).

content.text: A polygon supports the following properties:

content.code_html:
var myTrip = [stavanger,amsterdam,london,stavanger];
var flightPath = new google.maps.Polygon({
  path:myTrip,
  strokeColor:"#0000FF",
  strokeOpacity:0.8,
  strokeWeight:2,
  fillColor:"#0000FF",
  fillOpacity:0.4
});

content.text: Google Maps - Circle
A circle supports the following properties:

content.code_html:
var myCity = new google.maps.Circle({
  center:amsterdam,
  radius:20000,
  strokeColor:"#0000FF",
  strokeOpacity:0.8,
  strokeWeight:2,
  fillColor:"#0000FF",
  fillOpacity:0.4
});

content.text: Google Maps - InfoWindow
Show an InfoWindow with some text content for a marker:
content.html: Show an InfoWindow with some text content for a marker:

content.code_html:
var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow({
  content:"Hello World!"
});

infowindow.open(map,marker);
